ARABIC: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: receiving what their Lord has given them. Certainly before that they were good-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Receiving what is given them by their Lord. They were surely the virtuous before this.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: joyously receiving what their Lord will have granted them. Verily they did good works before (the coming of this Day):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: receiving their reward from their Lord. They had been righteous people before the Day of Judgment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Accepting the rewards given by their Lord; they were indeed virtuous before this.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Taking joy in the things which their Lord has given them. Verily, they were before this doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Taking what their Lord gives them; surely they were before that, the doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: taking whatsoever their Lord has given them; they were good-doers before that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Taking that which their Lord giveth them; for lo! aforetime they were doers of good;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They shall receive what their Lord will bestow on them. They have done good works in the past,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Taking that which their Lord will vouchsafe Unto hem. Verily they have been before that well-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: receiving what their Lord has given them, for they had been virtuous aforetime.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Taking joy in the things which their Lord gives them, because, before then, they lived a good life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Taking joy in the things which their Lord has given them. Verily, they were before this Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: receiving what their Lord will give them because before this they were gooddoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Receiving what their Lord has given them. They were virtuous before that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:16] receiving (ākhidhīna is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the person of the predicate of inna, ‘truly’) what their Lord has given them, of reward, for indeed formerly, [before] their entering Paradise, they had been virtuous, in the world.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Taking) content and pleased with (that which their Lord giveth them) in the Garden and it is also said that this means: they act upon that which their Lord commands them in the life of the world; (for lo! aforetime) before they were given this reward and honour (they were doers of good) they were good in their speech and action in the life of the world;
